tasks.details: Software support for engineering projects and product that require both domain expertise and software implementation.
Build software for projects and products related to power systems.
Created the Alana Home App (now branded for BC Hydro as HydroHome App) and Dashboard from architecture design, prototypes to production in an agile environment.

Designed and developed, from scratch to production, the Alana Connected-Home Platform that ingests, processes, unifies and stores smart home data from B2B web services using AWS. The platform provides insights for insurance and utility companies.
Designed and developed data pipeline in AWS to ingest real-time IoT data from B2B web services, process and store data in DynamoDB, Elasticsearch and S3 data lake for app operation, analytics and ML.
Led the Alana ML Engine for smart-home insights and anomaly detection, from model development and serving backend to web app that consumes the models and visualizes results.
Inference of smart home market shares in Europe using network data provided by a local telecom company. App usage analytics.
App usage analysis and report in jupyter notebook.
Developed Serverless GraphQL APIs for the Alana Connected-Home Platform that supports the Alana Home App and Dashboard. Built an Elasticsearch server for complex queries against DynamoDB tables.
Built GraphQL APIs (Serverless and EC2) in NodeJS and Python to serve data and ML models for the apps.
Led web and mobile app development from prototyping to production. Used React, GraphQL, Material UI, Storybook and AWS Amplify for development, Jira and Confluence for management.
As a startup, we worked with engineers and designers in an agile environment for product development. I led frontend and ML works.
Usage analysis of the first 400+ EV charging stations in BC. Prepared reports for NRCan, BC Hydro and municipalities.
Algorithm design, deployment, hardware setup and testing, and demonstration of smart charging benefit to stakeholders.
Used real-world charging data to develop and deploy algorithms for the first demonstrations of smart charging in BC.
Web app dev for smart EV charging control, automated report for electrical equipment testing, and work order system for internal use.
Automated reporting of electrical equipment testing.
Led survey on charging solutions in Multi-Unit Residential Buildings in BC, from project proposal, survey design to report.
Developed a method for power flow optimization in commercial buildings. Results were proposed as a new industrial standard and published in IEEE conference.
Soldering and assembly of high power equipment sold to international clients. Test EV chargers, BC Hydro switchgears, and smart meters.
